name: Homewood Suites Williamsburg

reviews.text: I booked a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite for our group of 4, and we couldn't have been more pleased. The rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable. We had a small problem at check-in, but Erin at the front desk handled it quickly, professionally and with an apology. Erin continued to be helpful throughout our stay..... answering all of our questions..... always with a smile. The breakfast was nice. We did not take advantage of the dinners, so I can't comment on that. Our only complaint would be that the temperature in the room was difficult to control..... We tended to be either too cold or too warm. Couldn't quite get it right for all the rooms at the same time.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay.....

likes.liked: — clean and comfortable, wonderful bed, 2 bathrooms

reviews.text: This group of women has made this trip to Williamsburg to attend a seminar for many years, staying in one hotel for the first 3 days and then switching to the hotel where the seminar is being held for the final 4 days. There has already been discussion about staying at the Homewood for the entire trip next year and signing up for the seminar minus the hotel room that's offered in the seminar package. The Homewood is a much nicer hotel and we can transport ourselves to the seminar as needed. I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great rooms and Pool!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WE have stayed here twice before. Very convenient to food and historic areas and Busch Gardens. We always get a 2bedroom 2 bathroom suite. The room size is amazing for families. You can get 1 King,1 Queen and 1 pullout sofa or 1 King 2 Queens and 1 pullout sofa which is what we get. TVs in all three rooms plus the kitchette really saves time and money. They have free breakfast every morning and free dinner Mon-Thur. Our kids love the pool it is very large for a hotel pool. The staff at the front desk are some of the nicest we have ever ran across, even checking in at 10:30pm. Can't be beat!
reviews.title: Great location, average hotel

likes.liked: — Convenient location to CW and other sights
likes.disliked: — No computers provided for guests to use to check email, print boarding passes, etc...

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Colonial Williamsburg, Jamestown and Yorktown. The hotel is exceptionally convenient to Colonial Williamsburg, and to the Colonial Parkway to get to Jamestown and Yorktown. The hotel seemed clean enough, our room wasn't ready at 5:00 pm when we arrived. The maids could do a better job of vacuuming the rooms --- crumbs that we had spilled near the couch on our first night were still there the morning that we left! The suite does have a full kitchen - full sized refrigerator, stove, microwave, dishwasher and plates, pots and utensils, if that is important to you. The free breakfast was adequate - scrambled eggs, sausage, rolls, bagels, cereals, fruit and danishes. Only a small selection of juice and coffee -- no soft drinks. The free evening reception on Monday - Thursday was nothing special... we ate some salad one day, but skipped it the other days... Eat at Huzzah in CW - it was exceptionally good, especially the crabcake sandwich. Also our meal at Christiana Cambell's tavern in CW was very good. For location, this hotel is great, but aside from that, it's just average.
reviews.title: Not up to par with other Homewood Suites

likes.liked: — It was close to the attractions.

description: All-Suite Hotel located 1 mile from Colonial Williamsburg & College of William and Mary; 4 miles from shopping.
